summary: The Harvest to Hue Act (H.R. 3358) aims to boost the US agricultural sector's capacity to produce natural color additives for food. The bill directs the Secretary of Agriculture to facilitate efforts within the Department of Agriculture, promote collaboration with various stakeholders, and focus research initiatives to support American farmers in growing, producing, and harvesting ingredients for natural food color additives. The bill highlights the benefits to the food supply, consumer choices, and farmer markets.
